intro: Gamochaeta calviceps, commonly known as the narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Gamochaeta calviceps is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local pollinators.
